text: Prueba cortesía Cimmeria. 21..04..2017. (r25). Color ámbar pajizo rubio transparente. Sabores intensos dulces de manzana con una buena dosis alcohólica. Cuerpo medio a intenso, meloso, denso. Bastante buena. Para repetir sin duda.

Botella Thanks of Lownbrau. 21/04/17. 
Color ambarino claro, sabor dulce manzana, cuerpo denso, muy rica.

Bottle. 21-04-2017.
Courtesy of Ferris. Thanks a lot!.
In short: sweet (of course) robust apple beverage.
Did i enjoy it: no doubt.
Pours clean dark gold with no head. Baked apple nose, caramel, sweet. Medium body, soft carbonation, viscous texture. Taste is smooth, alcoholic, really sweet, baked apples, some caramel. Good.
Bottle - Cooked apple with a nice peel brightness. Clear gold. Bright apple, touch of acidity, viscous and a light bitter peel in the finish.
Bottle. Thanks to Ferris. Golden colour with no head. Apple aroma. Sweet, apple, juice, tart taste. Medium to full body.

375mL bottle, from YVR (Vancouver) airport, pours a clear golden orange with no head. Nose is intense, with notes of caramelized apples, treacle toffee, and brown sugar. Flavour brings out an amazing apple quality, followed by treacle toffee, some caramel and only a hint of alcohol. Exceptionally well-crafted, with low acidity and almost no burn. Phenomenal.

bottle shared by tom10101, thanks bro! pours clear golden, red tint, showing its very nice legs. peanut butter aroma (!), which is of course odd, red apples, booze, brown sugar, woodsy if not woody, spices. flat carbonation, medium to full body - oily and sticky; sweet and lightly tart spicy finish. great sugar/acidity ratio - superb palate/mouthfeel in fact. fortunately, awkward aroma almost disappeared. still an interesting and tasty ice cider.

Bottle 200ml.
Pours golden with no head. Some legs. Looks sweet. Aroma is of tart apples, alcohol. Taste is of tart apples, lots of sugar, some acidity, alcohol. Palate: Full bodied. Flat. Overall: Very nice apples. Nice sugar. A fine sipper.

Bottle (200 ml) split with the Québec crew. Thanks to the lady for this bottle!

Appearance: Clear bright deep golden with nice legs. 

Aroma: Weird and not so enticing aroma dominated by alcohol (and almost thinner like notes) at first along tart apples and light brown sugar.

Taste: It gets a lot better here. It doesnt seem to be the same product. Medium sweetness that is perfectly balanced by a great biting acidity. Tart apples, brown sugar notes and light spiciness. 

Palate: Medium to full body. Still as it should be. Liquorous and sticky mouthfeel. Bright acidic finish.

Overall: The aroma is disappointing, but the taste and mouthfeel are awesome and exactly what I look for in an Ice Cider. Extremely enjoyable because of the perfect acidity level. With a better aroma, it would be one of the best Ice Ciders I have tried so far. Loved it.

UPDATED: FEB 21, 2015 Thanks to tom10101 for sharing that bottle. Pours a clear golden and completely still and leaves some legs on the glass. Nose is of cooked apples and alcohol, not the best aroma ever for an ice cider. Taste is moderately sweet and nicely tart, made of apple and brown sugar and ends on light peppery notes. Body is moderate and mouthfeel sticky and syrupy. It is not too heavy and really drinkable, really. Overall a nice treat, thanks Tom!

Bottle shared by James, pours shimmering golden with small ring of head but no lacing. Aromas and taste are clean apples with just the right amount of tartness and caramel. Wasnt super complex but perfectly balanced to let the dank apples shine. Awesome shit. Thanks for sharing dad

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2014 Bottle from Canada/USA duty free. Pours a clear caramel body with no lacing. Aroma is bright apple juice and sweet honey. Mouthfeel is sweet like candy apple juice; additional notes of honey, light maple and sugar. Really nice.
UPDATED: MAR 31, 2014 Glowing orange body. Bright caramel apple. Fairly straightforward but nice and intense. Moderate sweetness, slightly sticky and juicy.  Thanks James.

Bottle 375ml.[ Courtesy of fiulijn ]. ABV: 12.0%. Clear medium orange colour with virtually none head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy apple, wood, concentrated apple. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet, light to moderate  acidic and light bitter with a long long duration, apple, tart, wood, spicy apple, concentrated apple. Body is medium to full, texture is oily - syrupy and sticky, carbonation is flat, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20120420]

Bottled, thanks fiulijn!  Bright golden, viscous, no head. Intense aroma of red apples. Very sweet, full bodied and intense. Honey and red apples, some citrus and white pepper. Tarter green apples wrapped in honey in the finish.

Bottled. A dark amber cider with a rim of beige head. The aroma has notes of over ripe apples and alcohol, as well as light notes of mold. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol, over ripe apples, and mold, leading to a light tart and alcoholic finish. Very intense. Thanks fiulijn for sharing.
37.5 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with no head. Aroma is smooth fruity, crisp apples, dense floral. Sweet, honey like, sugarish and thick syrupy apples. Dense fruity finish.

Bottle at Alex.
Clear amber coloured with no head.
Fruity aroma of apples and dried apples.
Fruity flavour of apples and dried apples with notes of alcohol.
Warming alcoholic finish.

Bottle 37,5 cl. Courtesy of fiulijn. Pours a beautiful clear deep golden. Intense apple aroma with a fine balance between sweetness and acidity, sort of a sophisticated apple syrup with vanilla shining through. Warming alcohol in the finish. Delicious. 200412

Corked bottle, from Vancouver Intl Airport, international departures onlyBeautiful golden color. Nice aroma of apples, strewed apples; not as deep as the Sparkling one side to side, there is a dusty trace too, and light alcohol. Syrupy sweet, with a good flavor of apples, and good acidity level. Very good drink, although not very complex as the best examples.

Bottle courtesy of Paul at Andys for Pauls birthday and Joeys going away (and hopefully coming back at some point) tasting.  Pours a clear ruby tinged amber.  Sweet apples, acid and caramel.  Sweet acid, toast, more acid, sweet apple, toast and biting acidity.  More acid, lingering bite from the acid, more apple sweetness, toast and caramel.  Very nice, super smooth with long acid.

Phone rate. 375mL bottle, thanks paul for sharing.lots of apples with some cinnamon and toasted cookedness going on, some ETOH heat. Flavor still pretty hot, lots of appley goodness,  less spiced apples. Semi-dry. Full body. Very tasty.
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA

text: Bottle shared by Paul. Full, rich aroma of apples, clearly the cryo-extracted rather than concentrated (not frozen on the tree), but a very solid example of such. Granny smith, pear, passionfruit, bright and crisp fig, Luxurious body, intensely concentrated, honey and fresh farm cider. Excellent balancing acidity, perfect example of the style.

2003 vintage bottle labeled as "Ice Apple Wine" for export, bought in Kuala Lumpur (not cheap). Rich cinnamon/auburn, looks like amber the stone. Smells hot and strong immediately but then mellows into cinnamon and apple skins and has a simpler aroma than expected. Palate is thick, sweet and almost syrupy leaving a lot of sugars on the tongue. Very sweet but has a nice granny smith-like natural tartness for balance. There is not a lot going on, for its just simple, sweet, and nice. As it warms the acidity really comes through and makes for a nice balanced experience. Becomes mellower, less sweet. Although it remains simple, its tastier by the sip.

2003 bottle from Cold Storage, KLCC.  Pours with a bright bronze colour.  The aroma has some apple depth, food appley, with oats and cinnamon - apple crumble instead of apple pie!  The taste is appley first, with some good tartness for balance (I like tartness in an ice cider sometimes).  The finish, however, has a bit too much alcohol.  It is not as soft and warming as your typical ice cider, perhaps because its for the Asian market?  Still a fair amount of stickiness, but not as rich as some ice ciders.
